reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Conduct quarterly visits to the communities/Environmental Monitoring Clubs to assess their performance.

description.narrative: Community Environmental Clubs were set up to serve as link to penetrate community structures for enlightenment campaigns on peculiar environmental problems in parts of the Niger Delta. So far, club members were visited in all the six states of the Niger Delta where community clubs were established to ascertain their performance. This was to ensure that, the clubs work in line with their objective which was to monitor environmental pollution issues in their communities and report same to appropriate authorities and also to disseminate climate change information to local people. Oil spills, gas flaring and deforestation in parts of Delta, Bayelsa, Rivers and Cross River State necessitated the establishment of these clubs with the objective to assess performance of the communities’ emerging environmental challenges. After working with opinion leaders, club members were selected, given the training and clubs set up. Already, club members at community level have begun work in various communities where they are operating with some even taking up independent initiatives in reporting oil spills that occurred in their areas to National Oil Spill Detection and Response Agency (NOSDRA), being the Federal Government’s environmental regulatory agency for oil and gas activities in the country. Club members were encouraged to carry out campaigns within their communities and to create awareness and also plant trees as a measure to combat climate change effect. They were equally advised to register the clubs with the regulatory authorities so as to gain full status as Community Based Organisations. More so, strategies for engaging with the oil companies, government agents, and other stakeholders to ensure environmental safety in the region.

description.narrative: Club members’ confidence has increased significantly showing in their ability to independently report cases of oil spills and gas leakage in their communities.
